questions.description: Given a string consisting of only alphabets and characters, print the count of the alphabets and numbers respectively. If either count is equal to zero, do not print the corresponding result.
questions.inputFormat: A string of alphabets and numbers
questions.explanation: In the given string, there are 4 alphabet characters and 4 numeric characters.

questions.description: Write a python code to print the position or index of a given character from the given of string.
questions.inputFormat: A string of alphabets and numbers and the required character
questions.explanation: The character 'G' is present in the 7th position

questions.description: Given a string, print the n number of characters from the middle of the string
questions.inputFormat: A string of alphabets and numbers and the required number
questions.explanation: The middle position is 5 for the string, as such 2 characters from position 5

questions.description: Given a list of integers, print all the integers greater than the average of the given integers
questions.explanation: Average of the given list = 14. Numbers greater than 14

questions.description: Given a set of integers. Calculate the sum of integers present in the odd position in the list and multiplication of integers in the even position
questions.explanation: 12 14 and 16 are in odd position, so add them. 13 and 15 are in even postion, so multiply them

questions.description: Consider an n-element array, a, where each index i in the array contains a reference to an array of ki integers (where the value of ki varies from array to array). See the Explanation section below for a diagram. Given a, you must answer q queries. Each query is in the format j, where i denotes an index in array a and j denotes an index in the array located at a[i]. For each query, find and print the value of element j in the array at location a[i] on a new line. Click here to know more about how to create variable sized arrays in C++.
questions.inputFormat: The first line contains üo space-separated integers denoting the respective values of n (the number of variable-length arrays) and q (the number of queries). Each line i of the n subsequent lines contains a space-separated sequence in the format k a[i]0 a[i]1 … a[i]k-1 k -1 describing the k- element array located at a[i] Each of the q subsequent lines contains two space-separated integers describing the respective values of i (an index in array a) and j (an index in the array referenced by a[i]) for a query.
questions.outputFormat: For each pair of i and j values (i.e., for each query), print a single integer that denotes the element located at index j of the array referenced by a[i]. There should be a total of q lines of output.
explanation: We perform the following q = 2 queries:
Find the array located at index  i=0, which corresponds to a[0] = [1,5,4]. We must print the value at index j = 1 of this array which, as you can see, is 5.
Find the array located at index i = 1, which corresponds to a[1] = [1,2,8,9,3]. We must print the value at index j = 3 of this array which, as you can see, is 9.

questions.description: Given a string, print the number of alphabets and numbers in the string
questions.inputFormat: A string of alphabets and numbers
questions.explanation: There are 5 alphabets and 5 numbers in the string
